Maybe someday KSP will add simulated systems to the game, but for now, these don't do anything but look cool and finish out the IVA.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-30T18:50:35Z" title="04/30/2016 06:50  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 30, 2016</time> by Kram45**

Just a friendly reminder: This mod doesn't need updating since it's an IVA. The ASET props pack works with Raster Prop Monitor which is the only mod that needs updating. The functions it supports is a different story (VesselViewer, SCANsat, TAC LS, Engine Ignitor, MJ and the rest). Make sure your RPM is up to date along with the other function mods, if available. And FYI: Alex has already said that he's in the process of updating his mods on the ALCOR Pod thread. So please, relax with the "Are you going to update?". If there is a legitimate problem, post a log as per protocol.

[@ComatoseJedi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/91567-comatosejedi/) Indeed it does work in 1.1.x!  Thank you for pointing that out.  I installed it manually and was very pleasantly surprised.

What does it take to get mod uploaded to SpaceDock or gethub and getting the CKAN metadata updated for version 1.1.2 (or 1.1.99 if possible)?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-01T04:21:32Z" title="05/01/2016 04:21  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 1, 2016</time> by WildBillKerbin**

> 
> 
> On 5/1/2016 at 0:18 AM, WildBillKerbin said:
> 
> 
> [@ComatoseJedi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/91567-comatosejedi/) Indeed it does work in 1.1.x!  Thank you for pointing that out.  I installed it manually and was very pleasantly surprised.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> What does it take to get mod uploaded to SpaceDock or gethub and getting the CKAN metadata updated for version 1.1.2 (or 1.1.99 if possible)?
> 

I wouldn't suggest uploading someone else's work to SpaceDock. Especially without consent or hasn't been updated. I've seen several mods on SpaceDock that I know for certain that hasn't been updated for the current build of the game. It just leads to more problems that fills the mod maker's thread with "this doesn't work why was it on SpaceDock with the current build". CKAN is another story, because it gathers mods instead of being submitted. I don't use CKAN anymore, but I have used it and I can say it causes more problems than it solves. Unless you KNOW for certain the mods you are getting are the ones you've been keeping track of on the forums.

Manually installing your mods, including this one, makes you read the instructions on the dependencies it needs in order to work. If you don't make mods, at least have the common knowledge to know how mods work so you can help other people who tend to not know how mods work.

> 
> 
> On 5/1/2016 at 8:17 PM, ComatoseJedi said:
> 
> 
> Just a friendly reminder: This mod doesn't need updating since it's an IVA. The ASET props pack works with Raster Prop Monitor which is the only mod that needs updating. The functions it supports is a different story (VesselViewer, SCANsat, TAC LS, Engine Ignitor, MJ and the rest). Make sure your RPM is up to date along with the other function mods, if available. And FYI: Alex has already said that he's in the process of updating his mods on the ALCOR Pod thread. So please, relax with the "Are you going to update?". If there is a legitimate problem, post a log as per protocol.
> 

Thank you very much for this reminder.   I had not realized that it was going to work.   I needed to replace the nav-ball texture with one from RPM, but that was explained on the first few pages of the thread.     I was able to complete my first ALL-IVA mission in my "new" apollo-like craft.

OK so ran into problem today and idk what exactly is causing it.  The attitude screen is missing the digital ball, everything else seems to work fine, and even the attitude screen has all its read outs nav icons, numbers showing speeds, alt pitch roll, etc just the navball itself is missing, checked other pods and the mk1 iva replacement is having same issue, but stock cockpits the like mk2 space plane works fine, so it doesn't "seem" to be rpm.  Anyone else had trouble or any idea on where to trouble shoot?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, ironhawx said:
> 
> 
> OK so ran into problem today and idk what exactly is causing it.  The attitude screen is missing the digital ball, everything else seems to work fine, and even the attitude screen has all its read outs nav icons, numbers showing speeds, alt pitch roll, etc just the navball itself is missing, checked other pods and the mk1 iva replacement is having same issue, but stock cockpits the like mk2 space plane works fine, so it doesn't "seem" to be rpm.  Anyone else had trouble or any idea on where to trouble shoot?
> 

Ok so RPM can be customized on a per craft basis, the RPM pages are set by the mod author. ASET stuff in particular uses custom assets, so even though the stock navball for RPM works for other craft it can have an issue with certain IVA's specifically. The mod author is around but these IVAs haven't been updated in a while so those custom pages have issues with certain elements, likely a mod that is trying to display incompatible graphic elements onto the custom navball. 

So basically check your mod directory for anything that would touch the navball: Waypoint manager, docking alignment indicator, Enhanced Nav Ball, etc. Unfortunately once you find which it is you have to either live without it, wait for the IVA author to update the MFD pages or attempt to do so yourself. 

e. just saw this now myself, was being caused by the Ven Stock revamp

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-05T04:14:32Z" title="05/05/2016 04:14  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 5, 2016</time> by Terrible Inclinations**

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, ironhawx said:
> 
> 
> navball itself is missing
> 

Copy (and replace) "**NavBall000.dds**" from "***\GameData\JSI\RasterPropMonitor\Library\Components\NavBall***" into "***\GameData\ASET\ASET\_Props\MFDs\ALCORPFD***"

ya its working now don't ask me what happened, idk if mods got installed out of order or what, but i removed b9 set, launched game and navball was back, put b9 back in and navball still there, so go figure.
Is there a way to install the MFDs in a different pod?

> 
> 
> On 13/5/2016 at 6:27 PM, dlrk said:
>

> Is there a way to install the MFDs in a different pod?
> 

You mean the displays of a pod RPM's ready? If that's the case, the only way I manage to do so is by replacing part of RPM's mdf40x20.cfg with ASET's ALCORMDF40x20.cfg. But I assume it's not the best way (nor elegant) to do it.
